intro: Cieca hederacea, commonly known as the common ivy, is a climbing vine belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and can grow both as a ground cover or climb up structures. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by red berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in shaded areas. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it both a popular ornamental plant and a potential invasive species in some regions.
